p: Assuming that infected people are infectious upon infection, other factors affecting epidemic curves are person-to-person contact rates (i.e.,Â contacts per person per time period) and probabilities of infection on contact between infectious and susceptible people, or infectiousness. The sum of contacts by which susceptible people would be infected, which are products of these rates and probabilities [3], estimates the basic reproduction number, or average number of secondary infections per infected person.
